<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//===- Attributor.h --- Module-wide attribute deduction ---------&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Attributor: An inter procedural (abstract) &quot;attribute&quot; deduction framework.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The Attributor framework is an inter procedural abstract analysis (fixpoint</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration analysis). The goal is to allow easy deduction of new attributes as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// well as information exchange between abstract attributes in-flight.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The Attributor class is the driver and the link between the various abstract</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attributes. The Attributor will iterate until a fixpoint state is reached by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// all abstract attributes in-flight, or until it will enforce a pessimistic fix</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point because an iteration limit is reached.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Abstract attributes, derived from the AbstractAttribute class, actually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// describe properties of the code. They can correspond to actual LLVM-IR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attributes, or they can be more general, ultimately unrelated to LLVM-IR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attributes. The latter is useful when an abstract attributes provides</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// information to other abstract attributes in-flight but we might not want to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// manifest the information. The Attributor allows to query in-flight abstract</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attributes through the &#96;Attributor::getAAFor&#96; method (see the method</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// description for an example). If the method is used by an abstract attribute</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// P, and it results in an abstract attribute Q, the Attributor will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// automatically capture a potential dependence from Q to P. This dependence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will cause P to be reevaluated whenever Q changes in the future.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The Attributor will only reevaluate abstract attributes that might have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// changed since the last iteration. That means that the Attribute will not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// revisit all instructions/blocks/functions in the module but only query</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an update from a subset of the abstract attributes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The update method &#96;AbstractAttribute::updateImpl&#96; is implemented by the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// specific &quot;abstract attribute&quot; subclasses. The method is invoked whenever the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// currently assumed state (see the AbstractState class) might not be valid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// anymore. This can, for example, happen if the state was dependent on another</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// abstract attribute that changed. In every invocation, the update method has</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to adjust the internal state of an abstract attribute to a point that is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// justifiable by the underlying IR and the current state of abstract attributes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in-flight. Since the IR is given and assumed to be valid, the information</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// derived from it can be assumed to hold. However, information derived from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other abstract attributes is conditional on various things. If the justifying</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// state changed, the &#96;updateImpl&#96; has to revisit the situation and potentially</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// find another justification or limit the optimistic assumes made.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Change is the key in this framework. Until a state of no-change, thus a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fixpoint, is reached, the Attributor will query the abstract attributes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in-flight to re-evaluate their state. If the (current) state is too</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optimistic, hence it cannot be justified anymore through other abstract</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attributes or the state of the IR, the state of the abstract attribute will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have to change. Generally, we assume abstract attribute state to be a finite</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// height lattice and the update function to be monotone. However, these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// conditions are not enforced because the iteration limit will guarantee</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// termination. If an optimistic fixpoint is reached, or a pessimistic fix</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point is enforced after a timeout, the abstract attributes are tasked to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// manifest their result in the IR for passes to come.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Attribute manifestation is not mandatory. If desired, there is support to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generate a single or multiple LLVM-IR attributes already in the helper struct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// IRAttribute. In the simplest case, a subclass inherits from IRAttribute with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a proper Attribute::AttrKind as template parameter. The Attributor</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// manifestation framework will then create and place a new attribute if it is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allowed to do so (based on the abstract state). Other use cases can be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// achieved by overloading AbstractAttribute or IRAttribute methods.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The &quot;mechanics&quot; of adding a new &quot;abstract attribute&quot;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Define a class (transitively) inheriting from AbstractAttribute and one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (which could be the same) that (transitively) inherits from AbstractState.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   For the latter, consider the already available BooleanState and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#123;Inc,Dec,Bit&#125;IntegerState if they fit your needs, e.g., you require only a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   number tracking or bit-encoding.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Implement all pure methods. Also use overloading if the attribute is not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   conforming with the &quot;default&quot; behavior: A (set of) LLVM-IR attribute(s) for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   an argument, call site argument, function return value, or function. See</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   the class and method descriptions for more information on the two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &quot;Abstract&quot; classes and their respective methods.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Register opportunities for the new abstract attribute in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#96;Attributor::identifyDefaultAbstractAttributes&#96; method if it should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   counted as a &#39;default&#39; attribute.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Add sufficient tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Add a Statistics object for bookkeeping. If it is a simple (set of)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   attribute(s) manifested through the Attributor manifestation framework, see</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   the bookkeeping function in Attributor.cpp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - If instructions with a certain opcode are interesting to the attribute, add</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   that opcode to the switch in &#96;Attributor::identifyAbstractAttributes&#96;. This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   will make it possible to query all those instructions through the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#96;InformationCache::getOpcodeInstMapForFunction&#96; interface and eliminate the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   need to traverse the IR repeatedly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Helper to describe and deal with positions in the LLVM-IR.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A position in the IR is described by an anchor value and an &quot;offset&quot; that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><Highlight kind="comment">/// could be the argument number, for call sites and arguments, or an indicator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of the &quot;position kind&quot;. The kinds, specified in the Kind enum below, include</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the locations in the attribute list, i.a., function scope and return value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as well as a distinction between call sites and functions. Finally, there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are floating values that do not have a corresponding attribute list</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="comment">/// position.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NOTE: In the future this definition can be changed to support recursive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// below. The pointer is either a Value&#42; (for the first three encoding bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// combinations) or Use&#42; (for ENC&#95;CALL&#95;SITE&#95;ARGUMENT&#95;USE).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///&#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="normal">    ENC&#95;VALUE = 0b00,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="normal">    ENC&#95;RETURNED&#95;VALUE = 0b01,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="normal">    ENC&#95;FLOATING&#95;FUNCTION = 0b10,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="normal">    ENC&#95;CALL&#95;SITE&#95;ARGUMENT&#95;USE = 0b11,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Reserve the maximal amount of bits so there is no need to mask out the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// remaining ones. We will not encode anything else in the pointer anyway.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumEncodingBits =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointerliketypetraits-b09efd7701e511f6cdfa719094e47819/#af27fea0eb47fdcbf98bff1c8c8ba92de">PointerLikeTypeTraits&lt;void &#42;&gt;::NumLowBitsAvailable</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(NumEncodingBits &gt;= 2, </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;At least two bits are required!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="normal">  PointerIntPair&lt;void &#42;, NumEncodingBits, char&gt; Enc;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A visitor class for IR positions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Given a position P, the SubsumingPositionIterator allows to visit &quot;subsuming</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><Highlight kind="comment">/// positions&quot; wrt. attributes/information. Thus, if a piece of information</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><Highlight kind="comment">/// holds for a subsuming position, it also holds for the position P.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The subsuming positions always include the initial position and then,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="comment">/// depending on the position kind, additionally the following ones:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - for IRP&#95;RETURNED:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the function (IRP&#95;FUNCTION)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - for IRP&#95;ARGUMENT:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the function (IRP&#95;FUNCTION)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - for IRP&#95;CALL&#95;SITE:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the callee (IRP&#95;FUNCTION), if known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - for IRP&#95;CALL&#95;SITE&#95;RETURNED:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the callee (IRP&#95;RETURNED), if known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the call site (IRP&#95;FUNCTION)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the callee (IRP&#95;FUNCTION), if known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - for IRP&#95;CALL&#95;SITE&#95;ARGUMENT:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the argument of the callee (IRP&#95;ARGUMENT), if known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the callee (IRP&#95;FUNCTION), if known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - the position the call site argument is associated with if it is not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><Highlight kind="comment">///     anchored to the call site, e.g., if it is an argument then the argument</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><Highlight kind="comment">///     (IRP&#95;ARGUMENT)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/subsumingpositioniterator"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/subsumingpositioniterator/#a88c3ecf0e220e6dcd1afee9f86c8d806">SubsumingPositionIterator</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// map the requested Analysis to its equivalent wrapper in the old pass</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// updated. Only those new analyses that the client cares about in the old</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need SFINAE to check for the LegacyWrapper, but function templates don&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use a constexpr bool to perform the SFINAE, and then use this information</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inside the function template.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/analysisgetter/#a3ffc9a0b42f6f2d3a93baed3512f0520"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/analysisgetter/#a3ffc9a0b42f6f2d3a93baed3512f0520">HasLegacyWrapper</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1497"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1498"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The fixpoint analysis framework that orchestrates the attribute deduction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1499"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1500"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The Attributor provides a general abstract analysis framework (guided</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1501"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fixpoint iteration) as well as helper functions for the deduction of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1502"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (LLVM-IR) attributes. However, also other code properties can be deduced,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1503"><Highlight kind="comment">/// propagated, and ultimately manifested through the Attributor framework. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1504"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is particularly useful if these properties interact with attributes and a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1505"><Highlight kind="comment">/// co-scheduled deduction allows to improve the solution. Even if not, thus if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1506"><Highlight kind="comment">/// attributes/properties are completely isolated, they should use the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Attributor framework to reduce the number of fixpoint iteration frameworks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1508"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the code base. Note that the Attributor design makes sure that isolated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1509"><Highlight kind="comment">/// attributes are not impacted, in any way, by others derived at the same time</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1510"><Highlight kind="comment">/// if there is no cross-reasoning performed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1511"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1512"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The public facing interface of the Attributor is kept simple and basically</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1513"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allows abstract attributes to one thing, query abstract attributes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1514"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in-flight. There are two reasons to do this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1515"><Highlight kind="comment">///    a) The optimistic state of one abstract attribute can justify an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1516"><Highlight kind="comment">///       optimistic state of another, allowing to framework to end up with an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1517"><Highlight kind="comment">///       optimistic (=best possible) fixpoint instead of one based solely on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1518"><Highlight kind="comment">///       information in the IR.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1519"><Highlight kind="comment">///    b) This avoids reimplementing various kinds of lookups, e.g., to check</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1520"><Highlight kind="comment">///       for existing IR attributes, in favor of a single lookups interface</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1521"><Highlight kind="comment">///       provided by an abstract attribute subclass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1522"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1523"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: The mechanics of adding a new &quot;concrete&quot; abstract attribute are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1524"><Highlight kind="comment">///       described in the file comment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1525" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a8aedb3ab3b9d39e1ddc68d1c027af2f8">Attributor</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1526"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1527"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Constructor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1528"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1529"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Functions The set of functions we are deriving attributes for.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1530"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param InfoCache Cache to hold various information accessible for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1531"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                  the abstract attributes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1532"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Configuration The Attributor configuration which determines what</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1533"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                      generic features to use.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1534"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a8aedb3ab3b9d39e1ddc68d1c027af2f8">Attributor</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/setvector">SetVector&lt;Function &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Functions, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/informationcache">InformationCache</a> &amp;InfoCache,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><Highlight kind="normal">             <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributorconfig">AttributorConfig</a> Configuration);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1536"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a0ec7de1b5853de9ecb0a11eb2ac1c8d1">~Attributor</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Run the analyses until a fixpoint is reached or enforced (timeout).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The attributes registered with this Attributor can be used after as long</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as the Attributor is not destroyed (it owns the attributes now).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1543"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1544"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\Returns CHANGED if the IR was changed, otherwise UNCHANGED.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1545"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#acd850975ae5042cacb64a9d0ea4715f3">ChangeStatus</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#af7d3babc57be041df699846f65d231c8">run</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1546"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1547"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Lookup an abstract attribute of type \\p AAType at position \\p IRP. While</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// no abstract attribute is found equivalent positions are checked, see</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SubsumingPositionIterator. Thus, the returned abstract attribute</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// might be anchored at a different position, e.g., the callee if \\p IRP is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// call base.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is the only (supported) way an abstract attribute can retrieve</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// information from another abstract attribute. As an example, take an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// abstract attribute that determines the memory access behavior for a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// argument (readnone, readonly, ...). It should use &#96;getAAFor&#96; to get the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// most optimistic information for other abstract attributes in-flight, e.g.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1558"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the one reasoning about the &quot;captured&quot; state for the argument or the one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1559"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// reasoning on the memory access behavior of the function as a whole.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1560"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1561"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the DepClass enum is set to &#96;DepClassTy::None&#96; the dependence from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1562"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\p QueryingAA to the return abstract attribute is not automatically</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1563"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// recorded. This should only be used if the caller will record the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1564"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dependence explicitly if necessary, thus if it the returned abstract</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1565"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// attribute is used for reasoning. To record the dependences explicitly use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1566"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the &#96;Attributor::recordDependence&#96; method.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1567"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AAType&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1568" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a4f07dfd5d71c602655995567fe27d4a7"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AAType &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a4f07dfd5d71c602655995567fe27d4a7">getAAFor</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute">AbstractAttribute</a> &amp;QueryingAA,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1569"><Highlight kind="normal">                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition">IRPosition</a> &amp;IRP, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adadcb655edca867f08f7ea6068a7d8a1">DepClassTy</a> DepClass) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1570"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a5d9b598f1c0dd1ef47f78469582de44d">getOrCreateAAFor&lt;AAType&gt;</a>(IRP, &amp;QueryingAA, DepClass,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1571"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; ForceUpdate &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1572"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1573"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1574"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The version of getAAFor that allows to omit a querying abstract</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1575"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// attribute. Using this after Attributor started running is restricted to</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1579"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AAType&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1580" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a5d9b598f1c0dd1ef47f78469582de44d"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AAType &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/#a5d9b598f1c0dd1ef47f78469582de44d">getOrCreateAAFor</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition">IRPosition</a> IRP,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1582"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adadcb655edca867f08f7ea6068a7d8a1">DepClassTy</a> DepClass, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ForceUpdate = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1583"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UpdateAfterInit = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1588"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; AllowInvalidState &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1589"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ForceUpdate &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64falkorhwpffix-cpp/#a780618ccf661aebc12f8d991d294c950">Phase</a> == AttributorPhase::UPDATE)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Helper struct used in the communication between an abstract attribute (AA)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that wants to change the signature of a function and the Attributor which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// applies the changes. The struct is partially initialized with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// information from the AA (see the constructor). All other members are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2220"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// provided by the Attributor prior to invoking any callbacks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/argumentreplacementinfo"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ArgumentReplacementInfo &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2222"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Callee repair callback type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2223"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2224"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The function repair callback is invoked once to rewire the replacement</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2225"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// arguments in the body of the new function. The argument replacement info</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2226"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// is passed, as build from the registerFunctionSignatureRewrite call, as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2227"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// well as the replacement function and an iteratore to the first</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2228"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// replacement argument.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2229" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/argumentreplacementinfo/#a2083e74f7ea053500761e58968041ff7"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor/argumentreplacementinfo/#a2083e74f7ea053500761e58968041ff7">CalleeRepairCBTy</a> = std::function&lt;void(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2230"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ArgumentReplacementInfo &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function/#a1c9f2f058966db1f8ca270398bda8362">Function::arg&#95;iterator</a>)&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2231"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2232"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Abstract call site (ACS) repair callback type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2233"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2234"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The abstract call site repair callback is invoked once on every abstract</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2235"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// call site of the replaced function (\\see ReplacedFn). The callback needs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2236"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// to provide the operands for the call to the new replacement function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2237"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The number and type of the operands appended to the provided vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2238"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// (second argument) is defined by the number and types determined through</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2239"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// the replacement type vector (\\see ReplacementTypes). The first argument</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2400"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create a shallow wrapper for \\p F such that \\p F has internal linkage</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2596"><Highlight kind="comment">/// An interface to query the internal state of an abstract attribute.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2597"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2598"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The abstract state is a minimal interface that allows the Attributor to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2599"><Highlight kind="comment">/// communicate with the abstract attributes about their internal state without</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2600"><Highlight kind="comment">/// enforcing or exposing implementation details, e.g., the (existence of an)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2601"><Highlight kind="comment">/// underlying lattice.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2602"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2603"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It is sufficient to be able to query if a state is (1) valid or invalid, (2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2604"><Highlight kind="comment">/// at a fixpoint, and to indicate to the state that (3) an optimistic fixpoint</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2605"><Highlight kind="comment">/// was reached or (4) a pessimistic fixpoint was enforced.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2606"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2607"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All methods need to be implemented by the subclass. For the common use case,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2608"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a single boolean state or a bit-encoded state, the BooleanState and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2609"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#123;Inc,Dec,Bit&#125;IntegerState classes are already provided. An abstract</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2610"><Highlight kind="comment">/// attribute can inherit from them to get the abstract state interface and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2611"><Highlight kind="comment">/// additional methods to directly modify the state based if needed. See the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2612"><Highlight kind="comment">/// class comments for help.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2613" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate">AbstractState</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2614" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ab97d0bea9703add872e24cf8a24a5496"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ab97d0bea9703add872e24cf8a24a5496">~AbstractState</a>() = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2615"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2616"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return if this abstract state is in a valid state. If false, no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2617"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// information provided should be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2618" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ae2b42216b30b52bbb803df6884ef34d2"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ae2b42216b30b52bbb803df6884ef34d2">isValidState</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2619"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2620"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return if this abstract state is fixed, thus does not need to be updated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2621"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if information changes as it cannot change itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2622" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#adab11027e1a9fdc4c600bb8dba1df413"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#adab11027e1a9fdc4c600bb8dba1df413">isAtFixpoint</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2623"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2624"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Indicate that the abstract state should converge to the optimistic state.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2625"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2626"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This will usually make the optimistically assumed state the known to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2627"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// true state.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2628"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2629"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns ChangeStatus::UNCHANGED as the assumed value should not change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2630" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#aeafeaa2dc5ca5ca15830d8fa0b8762d2"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#acd850975ae5042cacb64a9d0ea4715f3">ChangeStatus</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#aeafeaa2dc5ca5ca15830d8fa0b8762d2">indicateOptimisticFixpoint</a>() = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2631"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2632"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Indicate that the abstract state should converge to the pessimistic state.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2633"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2634"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This will usually revert the optimistically assumed state to the known to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2635"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be true state.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2636"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2637"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns ChangeStatus::CHANGED as the assumed value may change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2638" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ac61c038186769d32f4f8c10168367965"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#acd850975ae5042cacb64a9d0ea4715f3">ChangeStatus</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate/#ac61c038186769d32f4f8c10168367965">indicatePessimisticFixpoint</a>() = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2639"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2640"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2641"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Simple state with integers encoding.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2642"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2643"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The interface ensures that the assumed bits are always a subset of the known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2644"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bits. Users can only add known bits and, except through adding known bits,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2645"><Highlight kind="comment">/// they can only remove assumed bits. This should guarantee monotonicity and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2646"><Highlight kind="comment">/// thereby the existence of a fixpoint (if used correctly). The fixpoint is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2647"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reached when the assumed and known state/bits are equal. Users can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2648"><Highlight kind="comment">/// force/inidicate a fixpoint. If an optimistic one is indicated, the known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2649"><Highlight kind="comment">/// state will catch up with the assumed one, for a pessimistic fixpoint it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2650"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the other way around.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2651"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> base&#95;ty, base&#95;ty BestState, base&#95;ty WorstState&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2652" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/integerstatebase"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/integerstatebase/#aa51ace657c81a6d9f1898490a85b6974">IntegerStateBase</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate">AbstractState</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2653" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/integerstatebase/#a11a9fa289a24c8b77f107f4ec0ef37d0"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/integerstatebase/#a11a9fa289a24c8b77f107f4ec0ef37d0">base&#95;t</a> = base&#95;ty;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3250"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Base struct for all &quot;concrete attribute&quot; deductions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3251"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3252"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The abstract attribute is a minimal interface that allows the Attributor to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3253"><Highlight kind="comment">/// orchestrate the abstract/fixpoint analysis. The design allows to hide away</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3254"><Highlight kind="comment">/// implementation choices made for the subclasses but also to structure their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3255"><Highlight kind="comment">/// implementation and simplify the use of other abstract attributes in-flight.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3256"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3257"><Highlight kind="comment">/// To allow easy creation of new attributes, most methods have default</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3258"><Highlight kind="comment">/// implementations. The ones that do not are generally straight forward, except</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3259"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#96;AbstractAttribute::updateImpl&#96; which is the location of most reasoning</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// associated with the abstract attribute. The update is invoked by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3261"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Attributor in case the situation used to justify the current optimistic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3262"><Highlight kind="comment">/// state might have changed. The Attributor determines this automatically</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3263"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by monitoring the &#96;Attributor::getAAFor&#96; calls made by abstract attributes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3264"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3265"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The &#96;updateImpl&#96; method should inspect the IR and other abstract attributes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3266"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in-flight to justify the best possible (=optimistic) state. The actual</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3267"><Highlight kind="comment">/// implementation is, similar to the underlying abstract state encoding, not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3268"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exposed. In the most common case, the &#96;updateImpl&#96; will go through a list of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3269"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reasons why its optimistic state is valid given the current information. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3270"><Highlight kind="comment">/// any combination of them holds and is sufficient to justify the current</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3271"><Highlight kind="comment">/// optimistic state, the method shall return UNCHAGED. If not, the optimistic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3272"><Highlight kind="comment">/// state is adjusted to the situation and the method shall return CHANGED.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3273"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3274"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If the manifestation of the &quot;concrete attribute&quot; deduced by the subclass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3275"><Highlight kind="comment">/// differs from the &quot;default&quot; behavior, which is a (set of) LLVM-IR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3276"><Highlight kind="comment">/// attribute(s) for an argument, call site argument, function return value, or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3277"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function, the &#96;AbstractAttribute::manifest&#96; method should be overloaded.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3278"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3279"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: If the state obtained via getState() is INVALID, thus if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3280"><Highlight kind="comment">///       AbstractAttribute::getState().isValidState() returns false, no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3281"><Highlight kind="comment">///       information provided by the methods of this class should be used.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3282"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: The Attributor currently has certain limitations to what we can do.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3283"><Highlight kind="comment">///       As a general rule of thumb, &quot;concrete&quot; abstract attributes should &#42;for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3284"><Highlight kind="comment">///       now&#42; only perform &quot;backward&quot; information propagation. That means</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3285"><Highlight kind="comment">///       optimistic information obtained through abstract attributes should</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3286"><Highlight kind="comment">///       only be used at positions that precede the origin of the information</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3287"><Highlight kind="comment">///       with regards to the program flow. More practically, information can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3288"><Highlight kind="comment">///       &#42;now&#42; be propagated from instructions to their enclosing function, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3289"><Highlight kind="comment">///       &#42;not&#42; from call sites to the called function. The mechanisms to allow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3290"><Highlight kind="comment">///       both directions will be added in the future.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3291"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: The mechanics of adding a new &quot;concrete&quot; abstract attribute are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3292"><Highlight kind="comment">///       described in the file comment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3293" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#acff34214cf426db8b010a1d977bd2899">AbstractAttribute</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition/#af247a28fd83cea9873d310162110439f">IRPosition</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aadepgraphnode">AADepGraphNode</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3294" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a75ba8812a0e7ec05d3a3fe2379e284e7"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a75ba8812a0e7ec05d3a3fe2379e284e7">StateType</a> = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractstate">AbstractState</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3295"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3296" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#acff34214cf426db8b010a1d977bd2899"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#acff34214cf426db8b010a1d977bd2899">AbstractAttribute</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition/#af247a28fd83cea9873d310162110439f">IRPosition</a> &amp;IRP) : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irposition/#af247a28fd83cea9873d310162110439f">IRPosition</a>(IRP) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3302" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#aca236017c4faa8178b362a663cf0fd68"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/attribute/#aab7ee4b8fd1d3e7e4cea87868855e60e">Attribute::AttrKind</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#aca236017c4faa8178b362a663cf0fd68">IRAttributeKind</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/attribute/#aab7ee4b8fd1d3e7e4cea87868855e60ea5e58e419b1c9e35d6131976412fd8f0c">Attribute::None</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3304"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function is used to identify if an \\p DGN is of type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AbstractAttribute so that the dyn&#95;cast and cast can use such information</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3306"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to cast an AADepGraphNode to an AbstractAttribute.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3307"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3308"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We eagerly return true here because all AADepGraphNodes except for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3309"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Synthethis Node are of type AbstractAttribute</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3310" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a31a0cab075117e825acb2b439efbc8bb"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a31a0cab075117e825acb2b439efbc8bb">classof</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aadepgraphnode">AADepGraphNode</a> &#42;DGN) &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3311"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3313"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// default) in its initializer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3314" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#afdcbf0c6bc57e95a2975054b96839b85"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#afdcbf0c6bc57e95a2975054b96839b85">hasTrivialInitializer</a>() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3317"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a call site positon. Default is optimistic to minimize AAs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3318" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a42f6982d76a1141138c99c4e1b989ba0"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#a42f6982d76a1141138c99c4e1b989ba0">requiresCalleeForCallBase</a>() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
