<Link id="l03321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3321" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#ad1dd04761b8274be5263c2363ae258f9"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute/#ad1dd04761b8274be5263c2363ae258f9">requiresNonAsmForCallBase</a>() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4098"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4099"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Map representing for accessed memory offsets and sizes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A key is Offset and a value is size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If there is a load/store instruction something like,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4102"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   p&#91;offset&#93; = v;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (offset, sizeof(v)) will be inserted to this map.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// std::map is used because we want to iterate keys in ascending order.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4105" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/derefstate/#a4df166621ea13df7d8c429d33f25ed7f"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::map&lt;int64&#95;t, uint64&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/derefstate/#a4df166621ea13df7d8c429d33f25ed7f">AccessedBytesMap</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Helper function to calculate dereferenceable bytes from current known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bytes and accessed bytes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4109"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// int f(int &#42;A)&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4111"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    &#42;A = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    &#42;(A+2) = 2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4113"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    &#42;(A+1) = 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4114"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    &#42;(A+10) = 10;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#96;&#96;&#96;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In that case, AccessedBytesMap is &#96;&#123;0:4, 4:4, 8:4, 40:4&#125;&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AccessedBytesMap is std::map so it is iterated in accending order on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// key(Offset). So KnownBytes will be updated like this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4120"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |Access | KnownBytes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |(0, 4)| 0 -&gt; 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |(4, 4)| 4 -&gt; 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// |(8, 4)| 8 -&gt; 12</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4579"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A pointer is privatizable if it can be replaced by a new, private one.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4585"><Highlight kind="comment">/// what values are necessary to make the private copy look like the original</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4586"><Highlight kind="comment">/// one, and the values we need can be loaded (=dereferenceable).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5237"><Highlight kind="comment">/// An abstract interface for potential values analysis.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5238"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5239"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This AA collects potential values for each IR position.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5240"><Highlight kind="comment">/// An assumed set of potential values is initialized with the empty set (the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5241"><Highlight kind="comment">/// best state) and it will grow monotonically as we find more potential values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5242"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for this position.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5243"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The set might be forced to the worst state, that is, to contain every</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5244"><Highlight kind="comment">/// possible value for this position in 2 cases.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5245"><Highlight kind="comment">///   1 We surpassed the \\p MaxPotentialValues threshold. This includes the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5246"><Highlight kind="comment">///      case that this position is affected (e.g. because of an operation) by a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5247"><Highlight kind="comment">///      Value that is in the worst state.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5248"><Highlight kind="comment">///   2 We tried to initialize on a Value that we cannot handle (e.g. an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5249"><Highlight kind="comment">///      operator we do not currently handle).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5250"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5251"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For non constant integers see AAPotentialValues.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5252" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapotentialconstantvalues"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapotentialconstantvalues/#a3dc887864611beaafbee729469c0b00f">AAPotentialConstantValues</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5253"><Highlight kind="normal">    : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/statewrapper/#addd441c5cf5062a6cb022b2e22d5c2a1">StateWrapper</a>&lt;PotentialConstantIntValuesState, AbstractAttribute&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
